citations.narrative:
The sheltered part of the facility was not sufficiently heated. The indoor temperature at the time of inspection was
measured to be 46.7 degrees Fahrenheit. The outside temperature at the time of inspection was measured to be 37.4
degrees Fahrenheit. The licensee has no means of heating the building at the time of inspection. This affects 22 dogs.
The ambient temperature must not fall below 50 degrees Fahrenheit and no lower than 45 degrees Fahrenheit for more
than 4 consecutive hours.
Temperatures below 50 degrees Fahrenheit could cause discomfort and possible health related conditions to the dogs.
The licensee must provide a source of heat to obtain a temperature of at least 50 degrees Fahrenheit for the health and
well being of the dogs.
The licensee must ensure that the sheltered part of the sheltered facility does not fall below 50 degrees Fahrenheit and no
lower than 45 degrees Fahrenheit for more than 4 consecutive hours.
To be corrected by: 2 Dec 23

A support beam underneath the outdoor section of the sheltered on both the east and west side has come unattached
from the support structure causing the floors of 2 enclosures, housing 4 dogs total, to sag creating a gap.
These gaps can cause injury or entrap the dogs paws/legs.
The licensee must repair and ensure that all floors are structurally sound as to not cause injury to the dogs at all times.
To be corrected: 15 Dec 23
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
3.3(a) 
   
Sheltered housing facilities. 
The sheltered part of the facility was not sufficiently heated. The indoor temperature at the time of inspection was 
measured to be 46.7 degrees Fahrenheit. The outside temperature at the time of inspection was measured to be 37.4 
degrees Fahrenheit. The licensee has no means of heating the building at the time of inspection. This affects 22 dogs.  
The ambient temperature must not fall below 50 degrees Fahrenheit and no lower than 45 degrees Fahrenheit for more 
than 4 consecutive hours.  
Temperatures below 50 degrees Fahrenheit could cause discomfort and possible health related conditions to the dogs.  
The licensee must provide a source of heat to obtain a temperature of at least 50 degrees Fahrenheit for the health and 
well being of the dogs.  
The licensee must ensure that the sheltered part of the sheltered facility does not fall below 50 degrees Fahrenheit and no 
lower than 45 degrees Fahrenheit for more than 4 consecutive hours.  
To be corrected by: 2 Dec 23 
3.6(a)(2)(x) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
A support beam underneath the outdoor section of the sheltered on both the east and west side has come unattached 
from the support structure causing the floors of 2 enclosures, housing 4 dogs total, to sag creating a gap.  
These gaps can cause injury or entrap the dogs paws/legs.  
The licensee must repair and ensure that all floors are structurally sound as to not cause injury to the dogs at all times.  
To be corrected: 15 Dec 23 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
